snippet: Many Venezuelans are anxious about casting ballots against President Hugo Chávez because of a widespread belief that the government retaliates against dissenters.
abstract: Many Venezuelans are anxious about casting ballots against President Hugo Chavez because of widespread belief that the government retaliates against dissenters; fear of reprisal may be enough to keep Chavez in office despite polls that show a surging tide of negative public sentiment against him.
lead_paragraph: Many Venezuelans are anxious about casting ballots against President Hugo Chávez because of a widespread belief that the government retaliates against dissenters.

headline.main: Fears Persist Among Venezuelan Voters Ahead of Election
headline.print_headline: Fear of Losing Benefits Affects Venezuela Vote
